tags.name: lrndesign-bar
tags.description:
`lrndesign-bar` a bar chart Events: * `chartist-render-ready` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired once once chart is ready. * `chart-data-changed` {`CustomEvent`} - Fires when chartData changes * `data-source-changed` {`CustomEvent`} - Fires when data-source changes * `data-changed` {`CustomEvent`} - Fires when data changes * `chartist-render-data` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired when chart is rendering. * `chartist-render-created` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired once chart is created features are added. * `chartist-render-draw` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired as shapes are being drawn. Attributes: * `axis-x-only-integer` {`boolean`} - Use only integer values (whole numbers) for the scale steps * `axis-x-min-space` {`number`} - TODO * `distribute-series` {`boolean`} - If set to true then each bar will represent a series and the data array is expected to be a one dimensional array of data values rather than a series array of series. This is useful if the bar chart should represent a profile rather than some data over time. * `horizontal-bars` {`boolean`} - Inverts the axes of the bar chart in order to draw a horizontal bar chart. Be aware that you also need to invert your axis settings as the Y Axis will now display the labels and the X Axis the values. * `reference-value` {`number`} - Unless low/high are explicitly set, bar chart will be centered at zero by default. Set referenceValue to null to auto scale. * `series-bar-distance` {`number`} - Specify the distance in pixel of bars in a group. * `stack-bars` {`boolean`} - If set to true this property will cause the series bars to be stacked. Check the "stackMode" option for further stacking options. * `stack-mode` {`boolean`} - If set to "true" this property will form a total for each series point. This will also influence the y-axis and the overall bounds of the chart. If set to "false" this property will force the stacked bars to draw from the zero line. In stacked mode the "seriesBarDistance" property will have no effect. * `height` {`string`} - Fixed height for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%'). * `reverse-data` {`boolean`} - Reverse data including labels, the series order as well as the whole series data arrays. * `width` {`string`} - Fixed width for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%'). * `chart-title` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use heading slot instead for progressive enhancement. * `chart-data` {`any[]`} - Raw data pulled in from the csv file and converted to an array. * `chart-desc` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use desc slot instead for progressive enhancement. * `options` {`any[]`} - gets options as an array * `pluginAxisTitle` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-axistitle, as in { axisX: { axisTitle: "Time (mins)", offset: { x: 0, y: 50 }, textAnchor: "middle" }, axisY: { axisTitle: "Goals", axisClass: "ct-axis-title", offset: { x: 0, y: -1 }, flipTitle: false } } See https://github.com/alexstanbury/chartist-plugin-axistitle * `pluginPointLabels` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-pointlabels, as in { labelOffset: { x: 0, y: -10 }, textAnchor: 'middle', labelInterpolationFnc: Chartist.noop } See https://github.com/gionkunz/chartist-plugin-pointlabels * `pluginFillDonutItems` {`any[]`} - Optional array of items for chartist-plugin-filldonut, as in items : [{ class : '', id: '', content : 'fillText', position: 'center', offsetY: 0, offsetX: 0 }] See https://github.com/moxx/chartist-plugin-fill-donut * `id` {`string`} - The unique identifier of the chart. * `type` {`string`} - The type of chart:bar, line, or pie * `scale` {`string`} - The scale of the chart. (See https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html)``` Container class Ratio .ct-square 1 .ct-minor-second 15:16 .ct-major-second 8:9 .ct-minor-third 5:6 .ct-major-third 4:5 .ct-perfect-fourth 3:4 .ct-perfect-fifth 2:3 .ct-minor-sixth 5:8 .ct-golden-section 1:1.618 .ct-major-sixth 3:5 .ct-minor-seventh 9:16 .ct-major-seventh 8:15 .ct-octave 1:2 .ct-major-tenth 2:5 .ct-major-eleventh 3:8 .ct-major-twelfth 1:3 .ct-double-octave 1:4``` * `responsive-options` {`any[]`} - The responsive options. From https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html: In addition to the regular options we specify responsive option overrides that will override the default configutation based on the matching media queries. `var responsiveOptions = [ ['screen and (min-width: 641px) and (max-width: 1024px)', { showPoint: false, axisX: { labelInterpolationFnc: function(value) { // Will return Mon, Tue, Wed etc. on medium screens return value.slice(0, 3); } } }], ['screen and (max-width: 640px)', { showLine: false, axisX: { labelInterpolationFnc: function(value) { // Will return M, T, W etc. on small screens return value[0]; } } }] ];` * `data` - Use an accessible table in unnamed slot for maxium accessibility and SEO. As table: .........
label 1
1
DEPRECATED Method: { labels: ["label 1", "label 2", "label 3"] series: [ [1,2,3], [4,5,6] ] } * `data-source` {`string`} - Location of the CSV file. * `show-table` {`boolean`} - The show data in table form as well? Default is false. * `accent-color` {`string`} - Location of the CSV file. * `dark` {`boolean`} - Location of the CSV file. Properties: * `axisXOnlyInteger` {`boolean`} - Use only integer values (whole numbers) for the scale steps * `axisXScaleMinSpace` {`number`} - TODO * `distributeSeries` {`boolean`} - If set to true then each bar will represent a series and the data array is expected to be a one dimensional array of data values rather than a series array of series. This is useful if the bar chart should represent a profile rather than some data over time. * `horizontalBars` {`boolean`} - Inverts the axes of the bar chart in order to draw a horizontal bar chart. Be aware that you also need to invert your axis settings as the Y Axis will now display the labels and the X Axis the values. * `referenceValue` {`number`} - Unless low/high are explicitly set, bar chart will be centered at zero by default. Set referenceValue to null to auto scale. * `seriesBarDistance` {`number`} - Specify the distance in pixel of bars in a group. * `stackBars` {`boolean`} - If set to true this property will cause the series bars to be stacked. Check the "stackMode" option for further stacking options. * `stackMode` {`boolean`} - If set to "true" this property will form a total for each series point. This will also influence the y-axis and the overall bounds of the chart. If set to "false" this property will force the stacked bars to draw from the zero line. In stacked mode the "seriesBarDistance" property will have no effect. * `height` {`string`} - Fixed height for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%'). * `reverseData` {`boolean`} - Reverse data including labels, the series order as well as the whole series data arrays. * `width` {`string`} - Fixed width for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%'). * `axisTitles` {`{ axisX: { axisTitle: any; offset: { x: number | undefined; y: number | undefined; }; textAnchor: string | undefined; }; axisY: { axisTitle: any; offset: { x: number | undefined; y: number | undefined; }; textAnchor: string | undefined; }; } | undefined`} - gets axis title options * `lineBarOptions` - override this with type-specific options * `chartTitle` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use heading slot instead for progressive enhancement. * `chartData` {`any[]`} - Raw data pulled in from the csv file and converted to an array. * `chartDesc` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use desc slot instead for progressive enhancement. * `options` {`any[]`} - gets options as an array * `pluginAxisTitle` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-axistitle, as in { axisX: { axisTitle: "Time (mins)", offset: { x: 0, y: 50 }, textAnchor: "middle" }, axisY: { axisTitle: "Goals", axisClass: "ct-axis-title", offset: { x: 0, y: -1 }, flipTitle: false } } See https://github.com/alexstanbury/chartist-plugin-axistitle * `pluginPointLabels` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-pointlabels, as in { labelOffset: { x: 0, y: -10 }, textAnchor: 'middle', labelInterpolationFnc: Chartist.noop } See https://github.com/gionkunz/chartist-plugin-pointlabels * `pluginFillDonutItems` {`any[]`} - Optional array of items for chartist-plugin-filldonut, as in items : [{ class : '', id: '', content : 'fillText', position: 'center', offsetY: 0, offsetX: 0 }] See https://github.com/moxx/chartist-plugin-fill-donut * `plugins` {`string[][]`} - an array of plugins to load as [ [classname, relativePath] ] * `observer` - mutation observer for table * `fullOptions` - gets options plus plugins * `windowControllers` - * `id` {`string`} - The unique identifier of the chart. * `type` {`string`} - The type of chart:bar, line, or pie * `scale` {`string`} - The scale of the chart. (See https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html)``` Container class Ratio .ct-square 1 .ct-minor-second 15:16 .ct-major-second 8:9 .ct-minor-third 5:6 .ct-major-third 4:5 .ct-perfect-fourth 3:4 .ct-perfect-fifth 2:3 .ct-minor-sixth 5:8 .ct-golden-section 1:1.618 .ct-major-sixth 3:5 .ct-minor-seventh 9:16 .ct-major-seventh 8:15 .ct-octave 1:2 .ct-major-tenth 2:5 .ct-major-eleventh 3:8 .ct-major-twelfth 1:3 .ct-double-octave 1:4``` * `responsiveOptions` {`any[]`} - The responsive options. From https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html: In addition to the regular options we specify responsive option overrides that will override the default configutation based on the matching media queries. `var responsiveOptions = [ ['screen and (min-width: 641px) and (max-width: 1024px)', { showPoint: false, axisX: { labelInterpolationFnc: function(value) { // Will return Mon, Tue, Wed etc. on medium screens return value.slice(0, 3); } } }], ['screen and (max-width: 640px)', { showLine: false, axisX: { labelInterpolationFnc: function(value) { // Will return M, T, W etc. on small screens return value[0]; } } }] ];` * `data` - Use an accessible table in unnamed slot for maxium accessibility and SEO. As table: .........
label 1
1
DEPRECATED Method: { labels: ["label 1", "label 2", "label 3"] series: [ [1,2,3], [4,5,6] ] } * `dataSource` {`string`} - Location of the CSV file. * `showTable` {`boolean`} - The show data in table form as well? Default is false. * `__chartId` {`string`} - * `accentColor` {`string`} - Location of the CSV file. * `dark` {`boolean`} - Location of the CSV file. * `colors` -

attributes.name: axis-x-only-integer
attributes.description:
`axis-x-only-integer` {`boolean`} - Use only integer values (whole numbers) for the scale steps

Property: axisXOnlyInteger

attributes.name: axis-x-min-space
attributes.description:
`axis-x-min-space` {`number`} - TODO

Property: axisXScaleMinSpace

attributes.name: distribute-series
attributes.description:
`distribute-series` {`boolean`} - If set to true then each bar will represent a series and
the data array is expected to be a one dimensional array
of data values rather than a series array of series.
This is useful if the bar chart should represent
a profile rather than some data over time.

Property: distributeSeries

attributes.name: horizontal-bars
attributes.description:
`horizontal-bars` {`boolean`} - Inverts the axes of the bar chart in order to draw
a horizontal bar chart. Be aware that you also need
to invert your axis settings as the Y Axis will now display
the labels and the X Axis the values.

Property: horizontalBars

attributes.name: reference-value
attributes.description:
`reference-value` {`number`} - Unless low/high are explicitly set, bar chart will be
centered at zero by default. Set referenceValue to null to auto scale.

Property: referenceValue

attributes.name: series-bar-distance
attributes.description:
`series-bar-distance` {`number`} - Specify the distance in pixel of bars in a group.

Property: seriesBarDistance

attributes.name: stack-bars
attributes.description:
`stack-bars` {`boolean`} - If set to true this property will cause the series bars
to be stacked. Check the "stackMode" option
for further stacking options.

Property: stackBars

attributes.name: stack-mode
attributes.description:
`stack-mode` {`boolean`} - If set to "true" this property will form a total
for each series point. This will also influence
the y-axis and the overall bounds of the chart.
If set to "false" this property will force
the stacked bars to draw from the zero line.
In stacked mode the "seriesBarDistance" property will have no effect.

Property: stackMode

attributes.name: height
attributes.description:
`height` {`string`} - Fixed height for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%').

Property: height

attributes.name: reverse-data
attributes.description:
`reverse-data` {`boolean`} - Reverse data including labels, the series order as well as
the whole series data arrays.

Property: reverseData

attributes.name: width
attributes.description:
`width` {`string`} - Fixed width for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%').

Property: width

attributes.name: chart-title
attributes.description:
`chart-title` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use heading slot instead for progressive enhancement.

Property: chartTitle

attributes.name: chart-data
attributes.description:
`chart-data` {`any[]`} - Raw data pulled in from the csv file and converted to an array.

Property: chartData

attributes.name: chart-desc
attributes.description:
`chart-desc` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use desc slot instead for progressive enhancement.

Property: chartDesc

attributes.name: options
attributes.description:
`options` {`any[]`} - gets options as an array

Property: options

attributes.name: pluginAxisTitle
attributes.description:
`pluginAxisTitle` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-axistitle,
as in { axisX: { axisTitle: "Time (mins)", offset: { x: 0, y: 50 }, textAnchor: "middle" }, axisY: { axisTitle: "Goals", axisClass: "ct-axis-title", offset: { x: 0, y: -1 }, flipTitle: false } }
See https://github.com/alexstanbury/chartist-plugin-axistitle

Property: pluginAxisTitle

attributes.name: pluginPointLabels
attributes.description:
`pluginPointLabels` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-pointlabels,
as in { labelOffset: { x: 0, y: -10 }, textAnchor: 'middle', labelInterpolationFnc: Chartist.noop }
See https://github.com/gionkunz/chartist-plugin-pointlabels

Property: pluginPointLabels

attributes.name: pluginFillDonutItems
attributes.description:
`pluginFillDonutItems` {`any[]`} - Optional array of items for chartist-plugin-filldonut,
as in items : [{ class : '', id: '', content : 'fillText', position: 'center', offsetY: 0, offsetX: 0 }]
See https://github.com/moxx/chartist-plugin-fill-donut

Property: pluginFillDonutItems

attributes.name: id
attributes.description:
`id` {`string`} - The unique identifier of the chart.

Property: id

Default: chart

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
`type` {`string`} - The type of chart:bar, line, or pie

Property: type

Default: bar

attributes.name: scale
attributes.description:
`scale` {`string`} - The scale of the chart. (See https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html)```
Container class	Ratio
.ct-square          1
.ct-minor-second	  15:16
.ct-major-second	  8:9
.ct-minor-third	    5:6
.ct-major-third	    4:5
.ct-perfect-fourth	3:4
.ct-perfect-fifth	  2:3
.ct-minor-sixth	    5:8
.ct-golden-section	1:1.618
.ct-major-sixth	    3:5
.ct-minor-seventh	  9:16
.ct-major-seventh	  8:15
.ct-octave	        1:2
.ct-major-tenth	    2:5
.ct-major-eleventh	3:8
.ct-major-twelfth	  1:3
.ct-double-octave	  1:4```

Property: scale

Default: ct-minor-seventh

tags.name: lrndesign-line
tags.description:
`lrndesign-line` a line chart Events: * `chartist-render-ready` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired once once chart is ready. * `chart-data-changed` {`CustomEvent`} - Fires when chartData changes * `data-source-changed` {`CustomEvent`} - Fires when data-source changes * `data-changed` {`CustomEvent`} - Fires when data changes * `chartist-render-data` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired when chart is rendering. * `chartist-render-created` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired once chart is created features are added. * `chartist-render-draw` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired as shapes are being drawn. Attributes: * `area-base` {`number`} - The base for the area chart that will be used to close the area shape (is normally 0). * `full-width` {`boolean`} - When set to true, the last grid line on the x-axis is not drawn and the chart elements will expand to the full available width of the chart. For the last label to be drawn correctly you might need to add chart padding or offset the last label with a draw event handler. * `line-smooth` {`boolean`} - Specify if the lines should be smoothed. This value can be true or false where true will result in smoothing using the default smoothing interpolation function Chartist. Interpolation.cardinal and false results in Chartist.Interpolation.none. You can also choose other smoothing / interpolation functions available in the Chartist. Interpolation module, or write your own interpolation function. Check the examples for a brief description.. * `show-area` {`boolean`} - If the line chart should draw an area. * `show-line` {`boolean`} - If the line should be drawn or not. * `show-point` {`boolean`} - If the line should be drawn or not. * `show-point-labels` {`boolean`} - Optional point labels * `point-labels-anchor` {`string`} - Optional anchor for point labels * `point-labels-offset-x` {`number`} - Optional x-offset for point labels * `point-labels-offset-y` {`number`} - Optional y-offset for point labels * `pointLabelFunction` - Optional interpolation function for point labels * `height` {`string`} - Fixed height for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%'). * `reverse-data` {`boolean`} - Reverse data including labels, the series order as well as the whole series data arrays. * `width` {`string`} - Fixed width for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%'). * `chart-title` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use heading slot instead for progressive enhancement. * `chart-data` {`any[]`} - Raw data pulled in from the csv file and converted to an array. * `chart-desc` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use desc slot instead for progressive enhancement. * `options` {`any[]`} - gets options as an array * `pluginAxisTitle` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-axistitle, as in { axisX: { axisTitle: "Time (mins)", offset: { x: 0, y: 50 }, textAnchor: "middle" }, axisY: { axisTitle: "Goals", axisClass: "ct-axis-title", offset: { x: 0, y: -1 }, flipTitle: false } } See https://github.com/alexstanbury/chartist-plugin-axistitle * `pluginPointLabels` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-pointlabels, as in { labelOffset: { x: 0, y: -10 }, textAnchor: 'middle', labelInterpolationFnc: Chartist.noop } See https://github.com/gionkunz/chartist-plugin-pointlabels * `pluginFillDonutItems` {`any[]`} - Optional array of items for chartist-plugin-filldonut, as in items : [{ class : '', id: '', content : 'fillText', position: 'center', offsetY: 0, offsetX: 0 }] See https://github.com/moxx/chartist-plugin-fill-donut * `id` {`string`} - The unique identifier of the chart. * `type` {`string`} - The type of chart:bar, line, or pie * `scale` {`string`} - The scale of the chart. (See https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html)``` Container class Ratio .ct-square 1 .ct-minor-second 15:16 .ct-major-second 8:9 .ct-minor-third 5:6 .ct-major-third 4:5 .ct-perfect-fourth 3:4 .ct-perfect-fifth 2:3 .ct-minor-sixth 5:8 .ct-golden-section 1:1.618 .ct-major-sixth 3:5 .ct-minor-seventh 9:16 .ct-major-seventh 8:15 .ct-octave 1:2 .ct-major-tenth 2:5 .ct-major-eleventh 3:8 .ct-major-twelfth 1:3 .ct-double-octave 1:4``` * `responsive-options` {`any[]`} - The responsive options. From https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html: In addition to the regular options we specify responsive option overrides that will override the default configutation based on the matching media queries. `var responsiveOptions = [ ['screen and (min-width: 641px) and (max-width: 1024px)', { showPoint: false, axisX: { labelInterpolationFnc: function(value) { // Will return Mon, Tue, Wed etc. on medium screens return value.slice(0, 3); } } }], ['screen and (max-width: 640px)', { showLine: false, axisX: { labelInterpolationFnc: function(value) { // Will return M, T, W etc. on small screens return value[0]; } } }] ];` * `data` - Use an accessible table in unnamed slot for maxium accessibility and SEO. As table: .........
label 1
1
DEPRECATED Method: { labels: ["label 1", "label 2", "label 3"] series: [ [1,2,3], [4,5,6] ] } * `data-source` {`string`} - Location of the CSV file. * `show-table` {`boolean`} - The show data in table form as well? Default is false. * `accent-color` {`string`} - Location of the CSV file. * `dark` {`boolean`} - Location of the CSV file. Properties: * `areaBase` {`number`} - The base for the area chart that will be used to close the area shape (is normally 0). * `fullWidth` {`boolean`} - When set to true, the last grid line on the x-axis is not drawn and the chart elements will expand to the full available width of the chart. For the last label to be drawn correctly you might need to add chart padding or offset the last label with a draw event handler. * `lineSmooth` {`boolean`} - Specify if the lines should be smoothed. This value can be true or false where true will result in smoothing using the default smoothing interpolation function Chartist. Interpolation.cardinal and false results in Chartist.Interpolation.none. You can also choose other smoothing / interpolation functions available in the Chartist. Interpolation module, or write your own interpolation function. Check the examples for a brief description.. * `showArea` {`boolean`} - If the line chart should draw an area. * `showLine` {`boolean`} - If the line should be drawn or not. * `showPoint` {`boolean`} - If the line should be drawn or not. * `showPointLabels` {`boolean`} - Optional point labels * `pointLabelsAnchor` {`string`} - Optional anchor for point labels * `pointLabelsOffsetX` {`number`} - Optional x-offset for point labels * `pointLabelsOffsetY` {`number`} - Optional y-offset for point labels * `pointLabelFunction` - Optional interpolation function for point labels * `pointLabels` {`{ labelOffset: { x: number | undefined; y: number | undefined; }; textAnchor: string | undefined; labelInterpolationFnc: any; } | undefined`} - gets axis title options * `height` {`string`} - Fixed height for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%'). * `reverseData` {`boolean`} - Reverse data including labels, the series order as well as the whole series data arrays. * `width` {`string`} - Fixed width for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%'). * `axisTitles` {`{ axisX: { axisTitle: any; offset: { x: number | undefined; y: number | undefined; }; textAnchor: string | undefined; }; axisY: { axisTitle: any; offset: { x: number | undefined; y: number | undefined; }; textAnchor: string | undefined; }; } | undefined`} - gets axis title options * `lineBarOptions` - override this with type-specific options * `chartTitle` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use heading slot instead for progressive enhancement. * `chartData` {`any[]`} - Raw data pulled in from the csv file and converted to an array. * `chartDesc` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use desc slot instead for progressive enhancement. * `options` {`any[]`} - gets options as an array * `pluginAxisTitle` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-axistitle, as in { axisX: { axisTitle: "Time (mins)", offset: { x: 0, y: 50 }, textAnchor: "middle" }, axisY: { axisTitle: "Goals", axisClass: "ct-axis-title", offset: { x: 0, y: -1 }, flipTitle: false } } See https://github.com/alexstanbury/chartist-plugin-axistitle * `pluginPointLabels` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-pointlabels, as in { labelOffset: { x: 0, y: -10 }, textAnchor: 'middle', labelInterpolationFnc: Chartist.noop } See https://github.com/gionkunz/chartist-plugin-pointlabels * `pluginFillDonutItems` {`any[]`} - Optional array of items for chartist-plugin-filldonut, as in items : [{ class : '', id: '', content : 'fillText', position: 'center', offsetY: 0, offsetX: 0 }] See https://github.com/moxx/chartist-plugin-fill-donut * `plugins` {`string[][]`} - an array of plugins to load as [ [classname, relativePath] ] * `observer` - mutation observer for table * `fullOptions` - gets options plus plugins * `windowControllers` - * `id` {`string`} - The unique identifier of the chart. * `type` {`string`} - The type of chart:bar, line, or pie * `scale` {`string`} - The scale of the chart. (See https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html)``` Container class Ratio .ct-square 1 .ct-minor-second 15:16 .ct-major-second 8:9 .ct-minor-third 5:6 .ct-major-third 4:5 .ct-perfect-fourth 3:4 .ct-perfect-fifth 2:3 .ct-minor-sixth 5:8 .ct-golden-section 1:1.618 .ct-major-sixth 3:5 .ct-minor-seventh 9:16 .ct-major-seventh 8:15 .ct-octave 1:2 .ct-major-tenth 2:5 .ct-major-eleventh 3:8 .ct-major-twelfth 1:3 .ct-double-octave 1:4``` * `responsiveOptions` {`any[]`} - The responsive options. From https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html: In addition to the regular options we specify responsive option overrides that will override the default configutation based on the matching media queries. `var responsiveOptions = [ ['screen and (min-width: 641px) and (max-width: 1024px)', { showPoint: false, axisX: { labelInterpolationFnc: function(value) { // Will return Mon, Tue, Wed etc. on medium screens return value.slice(0, 3); } } }], ['screen and (max-width: 640px)', { showLine: false, axisX: { labelInterpolationFnc: function(value) { // Will return M, T, W etc. on small screens return value[0]; } } }] ];` * `data` - Use an accessible table in unnamed slot for maxium accessibility and SEO. As table: .........
label 1
1
DEPRECATED Method: { labels: ["label 1", "label 2", "label 3"] series: [ [1,2,3], [4,5,6] ] } * `dataSource` {`string`} - Location of the CSV file. * `showTable` {`boolean`} - The show data in table form as well? Default is false. * `__chartId` {`string`} - * `accentColor` {`string`} - Location of the CSV file. * `dark` {`boolean`} - Location of the CSV file. * `colors` -

attributes.name: area-base
attributes.description:
`area-base` {`number`} - The base for the area chart that will be used
to close the area shape (is normally 0).

Property: areaBase

attributes.name: full-width
attributes.description:
`full-width` {`boolean`} - When set to true, the last grid line on the x-axis
is not drawn and the chart elements will expand
to the full available width of the chart.
For the last label to be drawn correctly
you might need to add chart padding or offset the
last label with a draw event handler.

Property: fullWidth

attributes.name: line-smooth
attributes.description:
`line-smooth` {`boolean`} - Specify if the lines should be smoothed.
This value can be true or false where true
will result in smoothing using the default
smoothing interpolation function Chartist.
Interpolation.cardinal and false results in
Chartist.Interpolation.none.
You can also choose other smoothing /
interpolation functions available in the Chartist.
Interpolation module, or write your own
interpolation function. Check the examples
for a brief description..

Property: lineSmooth

attributes.name: show-area
attributes.description:
`show-area` {`boolean`} - If the line chart should draw an area.

Property: showArea

attributes.name: show-line
attributes.description:
`show-line` {`boolean`} - If the line should be drawn or not.

Property: showLine

attributes.name: show-point
attributes.description:

Property: showPoint

attributes.description:

attributes.name: pluginAxisTitle
attributes.description:
`pluginAxisTitle` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-axistitle,
as in { axisX: { axisTitle: "Time (mins)", offset: { x: 0, y: 50 }, textAnchor: "middle" }, axisY: { axisTitle: "Goals", axisClass: "ct-axis-title", offset: { x: 0, y: -1 }, flipTitle: false } }

attributes.name: id
attributes.description:
`id` {`string`} - The unique identifier of the chart.

Property: id

Default: chart

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
`type` {`string`} - The type of chart:bar, line, or pie

Property: type

Default: bar

attributes.name: scale
attributes.description:
`scale` {`string`} - The scale of the chart. (See https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html)```
Container class	Ratio
.ct-square          1
.ct-minor-second	  15:16
.ct-major-second	  8:9
.ct-minor-third	    5:6
.ct-major-third	    4:5
.ct-perfect-fourth	3:4
.ct-perfect-fifth	  2:3
.ct-minor-sixth	    5:8
.ct-golden-section	1:1.618
.ct-major-sixth	    3:5
.ct-minor-seventh	  9:16
.ct-major-seventh	  8:15
.ct-octave	        1:2
.ct-major-tenth	    2:5
.ct-major-eleventh	3:8
.ct-major-twelfth	  1:3
.ct-double-octave	  1:4```

Property: scale

Default: ct-minor-seventh

tags.name: lrndesign-pie
tags.description:
`lrndesign-pie` a pie chart Events: * `chartist-render-ready` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired once once chart is ready. * `chart-data-changed` {`CustomEvent`} - Fires when chartData changes * `data-source-changed` {`CustomEvent`} - Fires when data-source changes * `data-changed` {`CustomEvent`} - Fires when data changes * `chartist-render-data` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired when chart is rendering. * `chartist-render-created` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired once chart is created features are added. * `chartist-render-draw` {`CustomEvent`} - Fired as shapes are being drawn. Attributes: * `chartPadding` {`number`} - Padding of chart drawing area to container element and labels * `donut` {`boolean`} - Displays chart as donut instead of pie. * `donutSolid` {`boolean`} - Draw donut segments as shapes instead of strokes. * `donutWidth` {`number`} - Donut stroke width, currently done in javascript. * `ignoreEmptyValues` {`boolean`} - Empty values will be ignored to avoid drawing unncessary slices and labels * `labelDirection` {`string`} - Label direction can be 'neutral', 'explode' or 'implode'. The labels anchor will be positioned based on those settings as well as the fact if the labels are on the right or left side of the center of the chart. Usually explode is useful when labels are positioned far away from the center. * `labelOffset` {`number`} - Label position offset from the standard position which is half distance of the radius. This value can be either positive or negative. Positive values will position the label away from the center. * `label-position` {`string`} - This option can be set to 'inside', 'outside' or 'center'. Positioned with 'inside' the labels will be placed on half the distance of the radius to the border of the Pie by respecting the 'labelOffset'. The 'outside' option will place the labels at the border of the pie and 'center' will place the labels in the absolute center point of the chart. The 'center' option only makes sense in conjunction with the 'labelOffset' option. * `showLabel` {`boolean`} - If a label should be shown. * `startAngle` {`number`} - Start angle of the pie chart in degrees where 0 points north. A higher value offsets the start angle clockwise.. * `total` {`number`} - Optional total you can specify. By specifying a total value, the sum of the values in the series must be this total in order to draw a full pie. You can use this parameter to draw only parts of a pie or gauge charts. * `height` {`string`} - Fixed height for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%'). * `reverse-data` {`boolean`} - Reverse data including labels, the series order as well as the whole series data arrays. * `width` {`string`} - Fixed width for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%'). * `chart-title` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use heading slot instead for progressive enhancement. * `chart-data` {`any[]`} - Raw data pulled in from the csv file and converted to an array. * `chart-desc` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use desc slot instead for progressive enhancement. * `options` {`any[]`} - gets options as an array * `pluginAxisTitle` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-axistitle, as in { axisX: { axisTitle: "Time (mins)", offset: { x: 0, y: 50 }, textAnchor: "middle" }, axisY: { axisTitle: "Goals", axisClass: "ct-axis-title", offset: { x: 0, y: -1 }, flipTitle: false } } See https://github.com/alexstanbury/chartist-plugin-axistitle * `pluginPointLabels` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-pointlabels, as in { labelOffset: { x: 0, y: -10 }, textAnchor: 'middle', labelInterpolationFnc: Chartist.noop } See https://github.com/gionkunz/chartist-plugin-pointlabels * `pluginFillDonutItems` {`any[]`} - Optional array of items for chartist-plugin-filldonut, as in items : [{ class : '', id: '', content : 'fillText', position: 'center', offsetY: 0, offsetX: 0 }] See https://github.com/moxx/chartist-plugin-fill-donut * `id` {`string`} - The unique identifier of the chart. * `type` {`string`} - The type of chart:bar, line, or pie * `scale` {`string`} - The scale of the chart. (See https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html)``` Container class Ratio .ct-square 1 .ct-minor-second 15:16 .ct-major-second 8:9 .ct-minor-third 5:6 .ct-major-third 4:5 .ct-perfect-fourth 3:4 .ct-perfect-fifth 2:3 .ct-minor-sixth 5:8 .ct-golden-section 1:1.618 .ct-major-sixth 3:5 .ct-minor-seventh 9:16 .ct-major-seventh 8:15 .ct-octave 1:2 .ct-major-tenth 2:5 .ct-major-eleventh 3:8 .ct-major-twelfth 1:3 .ct-double-octave 1:4``` * `responsive-options` {`any[]`} - The responsive options. From https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html: In addition to the regular options we specify responsive option overrides that will override the default configutation based on the matching media queries. `var responsiveOptions = [ ['screen and (min-width: 641px) and (max-width: 1024px)', { showPoint: false, axisX: { labelInterpolationFnc: function(value) { // Will return Mon, Tue, Wed etc. on medium screens return value.slice(0, 3); } } }], ['screen and (max-width: 640px)', { showLine: false, axisX: { labelInterpolationFnc: function(value) { // Will return M, T, W etc. on small screens return value[0]; } } }] ];` * `data` - Use an accessible table in unnamed slot for maxium accessibility and SEO. As table: .........
label 1
1
DEPRECATED Method: { labels: ["label 1", "label 2", "label 3"] series: [ [1,2,3], [4,5,6] ] } * `data-source` {`string`} - Location of the CSV file. * `show-table` {`boolean`} - The show data in table form as well? Default is false. * `accent-color` {`string`} - Location of the CSV file. * `dark` {`boolean`} - Location of the CSV file. Properties: * `chartPadding` {`number`} - Padding of chart drawing area to container element and labels * `donut` {`boolean`} - Displays chart as donut instead of pie. * `donutSolid` {`boolean`} - Draw donut segments as shapes instead of strokes. * `donutWidth` {`number`} - Donut stroke width, currently done in javascript. * `ignoreEmptyValues` {`boolean`} - Empty values will be ignored to avoid drawing unncessary slices and labels * `labelDirection` {`string`} - Label direction can be 'neutral', 'explode' or 'implode'. The labels anchor will be positioned based on those settings as well as the fact if the labels are on the right or left side of the center of the chart. Usually explode is useful when labels are positioned far away from the center. * `labelOffset` {`number`} - Label position offset from the standard position which is half distance of the radius. This value can be either positive or negative. Positive values will position the label away from the center. * `labelPosition` {`string`} - This option can be set to 'inside', 'outside' or 'center'. Positioned with 'inside' the labels will be placed on half the distance of the radius to the border of the Pie by respecting the 'labelOffset'. The 'outside' option will place the labels at the border of the pie and 'center' will place the labels in the absolute center point of the chart. The 'center' option only makes sense in conjunction with the 'labelOffset' option. * `showLabel` {`boolean`} - If a label should be shown. * `startAngle` {`number`} - Start angle of the pie chart in degrees where 0 points north. A higher value offsets the start angle clockwise.. * `total` {`number`} - Optional total you can specify. By specifying a total value, the sum of the values in the series must be this total in order to draw a full pie. You can use this parameter to draw only parts of a pie or gauge charts. * `height` {`string`} - Fixed height for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%'). * `reverseData` {`boolean`} - Reverse data including labels, the series order as well as the whole series data arrays. * `width` {`string`} - Fixed width for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%'). * `axisTitles` {`{ axisX: { axisTitle: any; offset: { x: number | undefined; y: number | undefined; }; textAnchor: string | undefined; }; axisY: { axisTitle: any; offset: { x: number | undefined; y: number | undefined; }; textAnchor: string | undefined; }; } | undefined`} - gets axis title options * `lineBarOptions` - override this with type-specific options * `chartTitle` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use heading slot instead for progressive enhancement. * `chartData` {`any[]`} - Raw data pulled in from the csv file and converted to an array. * `chartDesc` {`string`} - DEPRECATED: Use desc slot instead for progressive enhancement. * `options` {`any[]`} - gets options as an array * `pluginAxisTitle` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-axistitle, as in { axisX: { axisTitle: "Time (mins)", offset: { x: 0, y: 50 }, textAnchor: "middle" }, axisY: { axisTitle: "Goals", axisClass: "ct-axis-title", offset: { x: 0, y: -1 }, flipTitle: false } } See https://github.com/alexstanbury/chartist-plugin-axistitle * `pluginPointLabels` - Optional data for chartist-plugin-pointlabels, as in { labelOffset: { x: 0, y: -10 }, textAnchor: 'middle', labelInterpolationFnc: Chartist.noop } See https://github.com/gionkunz/chartist-plugin-pointlabels * `pluginFillDonutItems` {`any[]`} - Optional array of items for chartist-plugin-filldonut, as in items : [{ class : '', id: '', content : 'fillText', position: 'center', offsetY: 0, offsetX: 0 }] See https://github.com/moxx/chartist-plugin-fill-donut * `plugins` {`string[][]`} - an array of plugins to load as [ [classname, relativePath] ] * `observer` - mutation observer for table * `fullOptions` - gets options plus plugins * `windowControllers` - * `id` {`string`} - The unique identifier of the chart. * `type` {`string`} - The type of chart:bar, line, or pie * `scale` {`string`} - The scale of the chart. (See https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html)``` Container class Ratio .ct-square 1 .ct-minor-second 15:16 .ct-major-second 8:9 .ct-minor-third 5:6 .ct-major-third 4:5 .ct-perfect-fourth 3:4 .ct-perfect-fifth 2:3 .ct-minor-sixth 5:8 .ct-golden-section 1:1.618 .ct-major-sixth 3:5 .ct-minor-seventh 9:16 .ct-major-seventh 8:15 .ct-octave 1:2 .ct-major-tenth 2:5 .ct-major-eleventh 3:8 .ct-major-twelfth 1:3 .ct-double-octave 1:4``` * `responsiveOptions` {`any[]`} - The responsive options. From https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html: In addition to the regular options we specify responsive option overrides that will override the default configutation based on the matching media queries. `var responsiveOptions = [ ['screen and (min-width: 641px) and (max-width: 1024px)', { showPoint: false, axisX: { labelInterpolationFnc: function(value) { // Will return Mon, Tue, Wed etc. on medium screens return value.slice(0, 3); } } }], ['screen and (max-width: 640px)', { showLine: false, axisX: { labelInterpolationFnc: function(value) { // Will return M, T, W etc. on small screens return value[0]; } } }] ];` * `data` - Use an accessible table in unnamed slot for maxium accessibility and SEO. As table: .........

as in items : [{ class : '', id: '', content : 'fillText', position: 'center', offsetY: 0, offsetX: 0 }]
See https://github.com/moxx/chartist-plugin-fill-donut

Property: pluginFillDonutItems

attributes.name: id
attributes.description:
`id` {`string`} - The unique identifier of the chart.

Property: id

Default: chart

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
`type` {`string`} - The type of chart:bar, line, or pie

Property: type

Default: bar

attributes.name: scale
attributes.description:
`scale` {`string`} - The scale of the chart. (See https://gionkunz.github.io/chartist-js/api-documentation.html)```
Container class	Ratio
.ct-square          1
.ct-minor-second	  15:16
.ct-major-second	  8:9
.ct-minor-third	    5:6
.ct-major-third	    4:5
.ct-perfect-fourth	3:4
.ct-perfect-fifth	  2:3
.ct-minor-sixth	    5:8
.ct-golden-section	1:1.618
.ct-major-sixth	    3:5
.ct-minor-seventh	  9:16
.ct-major-seventh	  8:15
.ct-octave	        1:2
.ct-major-tenth	    2:5
.ct-major-eleventh	3:8
.ct-major-twelfth	  1:3
.ct-double-octave	  1:4```

Property: scale

Default: ct-minor-seventh

attributes.name: responsive-options
data
attributes.description:
`data` - Use an accessible table in unnamed slot for maxium accessibility and SEO. As table: .........
label 1
1
DEPRECATED Method: { labels: ["label 1", "label 2", "label 3"] series: [ [1,2,3], [4,5,6] ] } Property: data Default:

attributes.description:
`data-source` {`string`} - Location of the CSV file.

Default:

attributes.description:
`show-table` {`boolean`} - The show data in table form as well? Default is false.

Property: showTable

Default: false

attributes.description:
`accent-color` {`string`} - Location of the CSV file.

Property: accentColor

Default: grey

attributes.description:

Property: dark

Default: false
